title: England thrash West Indies by 238 runs in 1st ODI
byline: England thrashed the West Indies by 238 runs to win the first one-day international at Edgbaston on Thursday.

title: Heavy winds disrupt train services on Northern and Main lines
byline: Train operations on two major railway routes have been disrupted due to heavy winds and fallen trees on the tracks,  the Railways Department said.

title: Electricity breakdowns on the rise amid inclement weather
byline: With the prevailing inclement weather conditions sweeping across the country, the number of local electricity breakdowns has seen a noticeable increase, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said.

title: Heavy showers exceeding 100 mm and strong winds expected today as well
byline: The National Meteorological Centre has issued a weather advisory, forecasting heavy showers exceeding 100 mm in certain areas of the country. According to the Forecasting Division, these downpours are likely in some places within the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle, and Matara districts.

title: QR code introduced for easy TIN registration
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has introduced a QR code to simplify the registration process for Taxpayer Identification Numbers (TINs), Commissioner General of Inland Revenue, Ms. R.P.G.H. Fernando said.

title: Ministry says lower demand, high cost end 24-hour passport service
byline: The Ministry of Public Security said that the decision to end the 24-hour passport issuing service at the Department of Immigration and Emigration was made after considering the high operational costs of maintaining the round-the-clock service and a gradual decline in the number of daily applicants.

title: EC to issue gazette with the names in hand after midnight today
byline: With the deadline to provide the names of the nominated and elected members of the recently concluded Local Government polls by party secretaries expiring midnight today (30), the Election Commission of Sri Lanka will go ahead and issue the gazette with the names that are already in hand, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Over 20 more ex-MPs under probe
byline: Following the imprisonment of former Ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando, it came to light that the government has instructed for the expedition of investigations into well over 20 more similar cases involving former MPs and officials.

title: RCBâ€™s road to IPL 2025 final
byline: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have entered yet another final with hopes of lifting their maiden IPL trophy.

title: Sri Lankan woman nabbed at BIA with foreign cigarette stock
byline: A Sri Lankan female passenger was arrested by Customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning while attempting to smuggle a stock of foreign-manufactured cigarettes valued at Rs. 345,000.

title: Thai woman arrested at BIA with Rs. 510 million worth of cocaine hidden in teddy bears
byline: A female passenger from Thailand was arrested early this morning at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a large stock of cocaine concealed inside teddy bears.

title: Health officials advise extra precautions for vulnerable groups
byline: Health officials urge individuals with chronic illnesses to take extra precautions against Chikungunya as it can lead to serious health issues.

title: Adverse weather: 1,321 persons of 245 families affected in Colombo District
byline: Some 1,321 persons of 245 families have been affected in the Colombo District due to the adverse weather conditions from yesterday till 10 am today, the National Disaster Relief Services Centre (NDRCS) said.

title: Fallen tree damages 13 houses in Grandpass
byline: A tree fell on the roofs of thirteen houses at St. Joseph Street, Grandpass, leaving some 40 people displaced.

title: Trump tariffs can stay in place for now, appeals court rules
byline: US President Donald Trump can keep collecting import taxes for now, an appeals court has said, a day after a trade ruling found the bulk of his global tariffs to be illegal.

title: Aththanayake M. Herath passes away
byline: Former Senior Lecturer in Sinhala at the University of Peradeniya,  Aththanayake M. Herath, has passed away at the age of 73. University sources officially confirmed his passing yesterday.

title: CEB reports over 29,000 power outages
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has reported a total of 29,015 power outages across Sri Lanka as a result of the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Government to introduce hub-and-spoke model for transport system: Chaturanga Abeysinghe
byline: The countryâ€™s entire transport system will be subject to change in the near future with the introduction of a hub-and-spoke model where private and public buses will operate on a joint time table, Deputy Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Chathuranga Abeysinghe said.

title: Credit claiming battle for Aluthgamageâ€™s, Nalin Fernandoâ€™s prosecution
byline: A battle to claim credit for the prosecution of former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernanndo seems to be under way with a member of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya claiming that it was he who lodged complaints against the Minister before any others.

title: France to ban smoking on beaches, parks and near schools
byline: France will ban smoking in all outdoor places that can be frequented by children, health and family minister Catherine Vautrin has said.

title: Weather forces SLC to delay tournaments
byline: The Tournament Committee of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) has decided to postpone all ongoing SLC-organized domestic tournaments due to prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Bell helicopter deployed to rescue stranded fishing crew
byline: A Bell 412 helicopter has been deployed by the Sri Lanka Air Force to rescue the crew of a fishing vessel stranded at sea off the coast of Balapitiya.

title: Surgeries at Udugama Hospital come to a standstill
byline: Medical services at the Base Hospital in Udugama have been severely disrupted following the resignation of the hospitalâ€™s only anesthetist, sources said.

title: Dematagoda Chaminda named suspect in Rs. 27 million money laundering case
byline: The Colombo Financial Crimes Investigation Division has named Dematagoda Chaminda, also known as Chaminda Ravi Jayanath, as a suspect in the ongoing investigations into the allegations that he used a bank account under another personâ€™s name to handle funds amounting to Rs. 27 million believed to be proceeds from heroin and crystal meth trafficking.

title: Sajith questions restriction of local students to KDU Medical Faculty
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today questioned the governmentâ€™s decision to restrict local students to the Kotelawala Defence University (KDU) Medical Faculty and said it is a decision of small minded people.
